# description

**Instance Property**

A string representation of the date object.

## Declaration

```swift
var description: String { get }
```

## Discussion

The representation is useful for debugging only.

There are a number of options to acquire a formatted string for a date including: date formatters (see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateFormatter] and [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/DataFormatting/DataFormatting.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000029i]), and the `NSDate` methods [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDate/description(with:)], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDate/date(withCalendarFormat:timeZone:)], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDate/description(withCalendarFormat:timeZone:locale:)]

## Related Documentation

- **description(withCalendarFormat:timeZone:locale:)**: Returns a string representation of the date formatted as specified by given conversion specifiers.
- **date(withCalendarFormat:timeZone:)**: Converts the receiver to a calendar date with a given format string and time zone.

## Describing Dates

- **description(with:)**: Returns a string representation of the date using the given locale.
- **customPlaygroundQuickLook**: A custom playground Quick Look for this object.
